clinical_study.brief_title: COMPLICATIONS RELATED CARBOXYHEMOGLOBIN LEVELS IN SECOND HAND SMOKING PEDIATRIC TONSILLECTOMY PATIENTS
clinical_study.official_title: COMPLICATIONS OF SECOND HAND SMOKING IN PEDIATRIC TONSILLECTOMY PATIENTS

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine whether high carboxyhemoglobin level is a risk factor for postoperative adverse events in children exposured to carbon monoxide, especially enviromental tobacco smoke.

detailed_description.textblock: Also we want to measure bleeding volume and compare it with the carboxyhemoglobin levels.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Correlatin between carboxyhemoglobib levels of the second hand smoking children and postoperative complications and pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between carboxyhemoglobin levels of the second hand smoking children and intraoperative bleeding volume
secondary_outcome.description: Any relation between carboxyhemoglobin and bleeding?

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between carboxyhemoglobin levels and pain of the second hand smoking children
other_outcome.description: Does second hand smoking affects pain?

study_pop.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Patients 1-12 years old scheduled for adenotonsillectomy; written informed consent.
